intro: Teline osmarensis, commonly known as the Ossetian teline, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender stems and small, white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are finely divided, and it produces small, oval fruits that contain seeds. Teline osmarensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and potential medicinal properties.
